wikipedia_page.main: Michael Alexander Stern  (13 January 1922 – 14 July 2002) was the founder of the Waterford Kamhlaba United World College, a multi-racial school in opposition to South Africa's apartheid policies.

response: ** Michael Stern, Egyptian-born educator (died 2002)

Waterford Kamhlaba was established by Michael Stern in 1963. The school's mission was similar to the philosophy of the UWC movement, and Waterford became the fourth member school of the UWC movement in 1981.
* Alan McGregor (academic)Michael Stern Obituary The Guardian 2002 former Dean of Medicine, King's College, UK
